edu.frontrange.csc240.a4.coin3

Class CoinTossing

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.a4.coin3.CoinTossing

  • public class CoinTossing
extends Object
    Class simulates tossing a coin, and counting the outcomes. For a true simulation of a "fair" coin, the number of heads and tails after each toss should tend (in the long run) to be equal.

    This variant defines the Coin class as an inner class of the CoinTossing class, and makes the flip method a static method of the same class.

    Version:
    1.1, 2016-08-22, CSC-240, Assignment 4, Exercise 6.29 (variant 3)
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Instructor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  CoinTossing.Coin
      The Coin class enumerates the sides of a coin, naming them HEADS and TAILS.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Perform the simulation, and keep count of the number of heads and tails that appear. (As an extra task, the length of the longest run of heads and tails is also tracked--this too, in the long run, should tend to be equal.)

      • main

        public static void main(String... args)
        Main entry point.

        Execute:

         java edu.frontrange.csc240.a4.coin3.CoinTossing
        Parameters:
        args - unused

      • flip

        private static CoinTossing.Coin flip()
        Simulate the flip of a coin.
        Returns:
        HEADS or TAILS, uniformly, but randomly distributed.
